channel.title: Whys coding so complicated!
channel.description:
I have always been in some sort of situation where I wanted to come some sort of crown or custom item etc in and in every guide these are ALWAYS MY PROBLEMS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! *I follow the instructions it compiles ok but i go on my server and what I added does not work * The TUT creator says to add a code under a "LAST" bracket or some giberish like that I add it under the "last" bracket but what I was told to search and I end up getting an error * The TUTS say to search something in a certain spot I search it and it is not there..?
ANY HELP PLEASE I WAN'T TO LEARN HOW TO CODE BY SOMEONE WHO CAN REALLY CODE AND BE MORE SPECIFIC.... pleease..

item.title: Whys coding so complicated!
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

[quote=“Avalon, post:8, topic:278510”][quote author=jc22493 link=topic=367629.msg2784636#msg2784636 date=1242419324]

custom shit is client sided.

The models are client sided; not the item itself.

@Power For It: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/
That website will help you a lot.
[/quote]

Honestly, unless you have some minimal experience with other progamming languages, the Sun website won’t effectively teach the basics of Java.

A good book might be a better alternative.[/quote]
Yeah, but according to his problems and requests, he has minimal knowledge.

Read full topic

[/quote]
The models are client sided; not the item itself.

@Power For It: http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/
That website will help you a lot.[/quote]

Honestly, unless you have some minimal experience with other progamming languages, the Sun website won’t effectively teach the basics of Java.

A good book might be a better alternative.

item.title: Whys coding so complicated!
item.dc:creator: @Diabolus Diabolus
item.description:
@Diabolus wrote:

  1. It may not be compatible with your Server’s base
  2. The last bracket means something like

public void test() {
sendMessage(“test”);
}

The tut creator will usually tell you to search for a void, and when you find the void, the ending bracket means the void is over, so you can make a new one.
3. press CTRL + F and search that, make sure you erase all of the spaces in it so if it were like

void something() {

you would make it

void something() { because your server base may be different.

Read full topic
